skill.name: api-design-principles
skill.description: Master REST and GraphQL API design principles to build intuitive, scalable, and maintainable APIs that delight developers. Use when designing new APIs, reviewing API specifications, or establishing API design standards.
skill.summary: Master REST and GraphQL API design principles to build intuitive, scalable, and maintainable APIs th...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: This skill contains only educational documentation, code templates, and best practices for API design. No executable code, network calls, or data access patterns were found. The content is purely instructional with static examples and checklists.

content.user_title: Design REST and GraphQL APIs with confidence
content.value_statement: API design decisions often become inconsistent and hard to maintain. This skill provides clear patterns, templates, and checklists to guide your choices.
actual_capabilities: Explains REST resource naming, methods, and status code patterns
Provides GraphQL schema and resolver design examples
Includes pagination, filtering, and error handling patterns
Supplies a FastAPI REST API template with middleware
Offers a pre-implementation API design checklist
limitations: Does not generate a full API project or database layer
Does not run automated validation or linting
Does not integrate with existing codebases automatically
Does not cover deployment or hosting setup

use_cases.title: Define new API standards
use_cases.description: Create consistent REST and GraphQL rules for a team before implementation.

use_cases.title: Review API specifications
use_cases.description: Audit specs for naming, versioning, and error handling issues.

use_cases.title: Improve API usability
use_cases.description: Refine endpoints and schema to reduce client confusion and rework.

prompt_templates.title: REST basics review
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a draft REST API spec
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this REST API outline and list naming, method, and status code fixes. Provide a short corrected example.

prompt_templates.title: GraphQL schema check
prompt_templates.scenario: You wrote a GraphQL schema draft
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate this GraphQL schema for pagination, input types, and error patterns. Suggest improvements with brief examples.

prompt_templates.title: Versioning strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Recommend a versioning approach for this API and explain the tradeoffs. Provide a migration checklist.

prompt_templates.title: Design checklist run
prompt_templates.prompt: Apply an API design checklist to this spec and return pass or fail with fixes for each failed item.

output_examples.input: Review my user and order endpoints for REST best practices.
output: Replace action paths like /api/createUser with POST /api/users
Add pagination to list endpoints with page and page_size
Return 201 Created on successful POST and 204 on DELETE

best_practices: Document versioning and deprecation rules before launch
Use consistent error formats with stable error codes
Paginate all collection endpoints with clear limits
anti_patterns: Deeply nested resource paths beyond two levels
Returning inconsistent error shapes across endpoints

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The guidance is platform agnostic and works in Claude, Codex, and Claude Code.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides patterns and templates but does not generate a full working API service.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing codebase?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the checklist and templates to align your existing endpoints and schema.

faq.question: Does it access or store sensitive data?
faq.answer: No. It only provides static guidance and examples.

faq.question: What if my API design is not covered?
faq.answer: Provide your spec and goals, then ask for targeted recommendations.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic API advice?
faq.answer: It includes concrete REST and GraphQL patterns with checklists and templates.
